intro: Maytenus rigida, commonly known as the rigid mayten, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Cornaceae, which includes the witchhazel family. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry or rocky habitats. Maytenus rigida is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
